alert.note: Alert for Benton; Mille Lacs; Sherburne; Stearns; Wright (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 09 at 8:50AM CDT until May 09 at 9:30AM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: The National Weather Service in the Twin Cities has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Wright County in central Minnesota... Southwestern Mille Lacs County in east central Minnesota... Eastern Benton County in central Minnesota... Sherburne County in central Minnesota... Southeastern Stearns County in central Minnesota... * Until 930 AM CDT. * At 849 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 6 miles northeast of Kimball, or 13 miles south of St. Cloud, moving northeast at 70 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported golf ball size hail in Kimball at 843 AM CDT. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Clearwater around 855 AM CDT. St. Cloud and Clear Lake around 900 AM CDT. Becker around 905 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Princeton and Foreston. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: This storm is producing large hail. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows! To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in the Twin Cities.

area.areaDesc: Benton; Mille Lacs; Sherburne; Stearns; Wright
